main event: A rapidly maneuvered object, like an energy wheel, was observed for 6-8 seconds in Georgetown, Massachusetts on July 5, 1955.
interesting points: The object traveled a circular flight path from east to north at an extremely fast rate of speed, estimated to be approximately 230 ft in diameter.
The object was observed for a period of 3 or 4 seconds on June 27, 1955 in Georgetown, Massachusetts. It was approximately 25-30 feet in diameter and circular in shape.
Three silver balls were observed on May 25, 1955 in Georgetown, Massachusetts. The objects were luminous, moved erratically, and disappeared rapidly.
The UFO remained in sight for 15-20 seconds, then vanished like a plug being pulled.
The sighting was investigated by the United States Air Force as part of Project Blue Book, a program that studied unidentified flying objects.
sighted object: rapidly maneuvered circular object, three silver balls
